reasons_to_visit.reason: Peak Summer Weather & Lake Geneva Life
reasons_to_visit.details: July is typically Geneva's warmest month (avg highs 26°C/79°F) with long daylight hours, perfect for swimming in Lake Geneva (Bains des Pâquis, Genève Plage), paddleboarding, enjoying lakeside cafes, and vibrant outdoor life.
Experience Geneva's popular swimming spots like the iconic Bains des Pâquis or the larger Genève Plage, offering swimming, sunbathing, and social hubs right on the lake.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Ideal for Lake Geneva Boat Trips
reasons_to_visit.details: Warm weather and long evenings make it the perfect time for scenic boat excursions on Lake Geneva, exploring charming nearby towns like Yvoire (France) or Nyon.
Enjoy the 'Musiques en été' festival offering numerous free open-air concerts (classical, jazz, world music) in beautiful park settings, plus open-air cinema like CinéTransat.
Excellent month for taking the cable car up Mont Salève for stunning views (and cooler air), or exploring the nearby Genevan vineyards (e.g., Satigny).
Depending on the year's schedule, the build-up or start of the large Fêtes de Genève festival might occur in late July, bringing extra lakeside entertainment and food stalls (check dates).

reasons_to_reconsider.details: July is high season. Expect significant crowds at popular attractions (Jet d'Eau, Old Town), along the lakefront, at swimming spots, and during major events.
Accommodation and flight prices are at their peak. Booking many months in advance is crucial for availability and better rates.
July can bring heatwaves with noticeable humidity, potentially making extensive city walking uncomfortable midday. Afternoon thunderstorms are common and can be intense.
Popular hotels, specific boat tours, desirable lakeside restaurant tables, event tickets (if applicable), and even some popular activities require advance booking.
The lakefront promenades, Bains des Pâquis, Genève Plage, and public transport (especially lake boats - 'Mouettes') can be very crowded, particularly on sunny weekends.

weather.precipitation: Generally warm and sunny with long daylight hours. High chance of afternoon thunderstorms, sometimes heavy. Can feel humid.
weather.general_tips: Pack light summer clothes (shorts, t-shirts, dresses), swimwear, sunglasses, high SPF sunscreen, sun hat. Essential to have a light rain jacket/umbrella. Comfortable walking sandals/shoes.

tourism_level.crowds: Peak season begins. Very crowded around the lake, Jet d'Eau, Old Town, and swimming spots on warm days.
tourism_level.pricing: Highest prices for flights and hotels.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Vibrant summer energy. City buzzes with locals and tourists enjoying the lake, parks, outdoor dining, and numerous events.

events_holidays.name: Musiques en été (Start/Ongoing)
events_holidays.description: Festival offering free open-air concerts (classical, jazz, world music) usually held on the Ella Fitzgerald Stage in Parc La Grange.
events_holidays.notes: Check the official program for specific dates, artists, and times. Popular events fill up quickly.

events_holidays.name: CinéTransat (Open-Air Cinema - Potential Start)
events_holidays.description: Free open-air cinema screenings in Parc La Perle du Lac, often with themed evenings and food stalls.
events_holidays.notes: Bring a blanket. Arrive early for good spots. Check the program online.

unique_experiences.activity: Swim & Relax at Bains des Pâquis
unique_experiences.description: Iconic Genevan experience. Swim in the lake, sunbathe on the pier, enjoy the sauna/hammam (check summer availability), have affordable lunch at the buvette.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Small entry fee. Can get extremely crowded. Offers great views of the Jet d'Eau. Changing rooms/lockers available.

unique_experiences.where: Various stops around the lake basin
unique_experiences.description: Use the yellow Mouettes Genevoises boats as part of the public transport system for short, scenic hops across the lake.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Included in Geneva Transport Card/day passes. Frequent service between Pâquis, Molard, Eaux-Vives, and Genève Plage.

unique_experiences.activity: Ascend Mont Salève via Cable Car
unique_experiences.description: Escape the city heat and enjoy breathtaking panoramic views of Geneva, the lake, the Jura mountains, and the Alps (including Mont Blanc on clear days). Hiking trails available at the top.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check weather/visibility before going. Bring passport (it's in France). Wear layers as it's cooler. Restaurant/cafe at the top.

unique_experiences.activity: Explore the Old Town & Enjoy Outdoor Cafes
unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic cobblestone streets, visit St. Peter's Cathedral (climb towers for views), browse antique shops, and relax at a cafe on the charming Place du Bourg-de-Four.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes. Can be hilly. Many restaurants offer outdoor seating.

weather.precipitation: Continues warm/hot and potentially humid. Afternoon thunderstorms remain a frequent possibility.
weather.general_tips: Stay hydrated. Plan strenuous activities for cooler mornings/evenings. Always carry sun protection and possibly rain gear.

tourism_level.crowds: Remains at peak holiday season levels. Very busy everywhere, especially if Fêtes de Genève preparations/start.
tourism_level.pricing: Persistently highest prices. Book well in advance.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Full summer swing. Long evenings encourage outdoor dining, lakeside strolling, and attending open-air events. Potential buzz from Fêtes de Genève setup.

events_holidays.name: Musiques en été (Ongoing)
events_holidays.description: Continued free open-air concerts in Parc La Grange.
events_holidays.notes: Check program online. Arrive early for popular concerts.

events_holidays.name: CinéTransat (Ongoing)
events_holidays.description: Free open-air cinema in Parc La Perle du Lac continues.
events_holidays.notes: Very popular, especially on warm nights. Check film schedule.

events_holidays.name: Fêtes de Genève (Potential Start / Setup)
events_holidays.date: Often late July/early August (Check specific dates!)
events_holidays.description: Major summer festival along the lakefront. Setup involves fairground rides, food stalls, stages. If it starts late July, expect large crowds, music, and fireworks.
events_holidays.notes: Dates vary yearly! Check the official website. Can significantly impact lakefront access and atmosphere.

unique_experiences.description: Spend a day at Geneva's largest lakeside lido, featuring pools (including Olympic size), lake access, waterslides, restaurant, and large grassy areas.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Entry fee required. Can get very busy. Family-friendly. Accessible by bus or Mouette.

unique_experiences.activity: Take a Boat Trip to Yvoire (France)
unique_experiences.where: Departing from Jardin Anglais or Eaux-Vives
unique_experiences.description: Take a scenic CGN boat cruise across the lake to the beautifully preserved medieval village of Yvoire, known for its flowers and castle.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Bring passport. Allow at least half a day. Check boat schedules (less frequent than shorter trips). Book tickets in advance if possible.

unique_experiences.activity: Attend a Musiques en été Concert
unique_experiences.where: Scène Ella Fitzgerald, Parc La Grange
unique_experiences.description: Experience a free, high-quality concert (various genres) in a beautiful park setting on a warm summer evening.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Bring a picnic blanket or folding chair. Arrive early to get a good spot, especially for well-known artists. Food/drink stalls usually available.

unique_experiences.activity: Paddleboarding or Kayaking on the Lake
unique_experiences.where: Various rental spots (e.g., Tropical Corner near Genève Plage, Eaux-Vives)
unique_experiences.description: Rent a stand-up paddleboard (SUP) or kayak to explore the lake at your own pace and enjoy the water.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check rental availability and prices. Wear swimwear. Consider water conditions (can get choppy).
